gw.api.intentionallogging

Interface IntentionalLogger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntentionalLoggerImpl, NoOperatingIntentionalLogger

    public interface IntentionalLogger
    This interface is intended to record event oriented logs. Produced logs always contain the context of an operation being processed. The convention defined with this interface is primarily focused on standardizing and improving logs to make OPS-ing much easier. There are two types of events: - Lifecycle Events - that record the lifecycle of the operation, - Subsequent Events - that record any error, event or important detail that happened in the meantime.

    Intentional logging implementation relies on org.slf4j.Marker class a lot (e.g. logging events, configuration). It assumes that a specific implementation of this interface in use has equals and hashcode methods in place which are in line with documentation in org.slf4j.Marker.
